title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Stellantis starts new Jeep Compass production in Italy
items.summary:
- Stellantis began production of the new generation Jeep Compass at its *Melfi* plant in southern *Italy*, in a bid to revive *sales* and curb falling output. 
- The Compass is initially built as a *hybrid* and an *electric* model on the *STLA Medium* platform, with a range of 650 km; a plug‑in hybrid version follows in early 2026, with first deliveries by the end of 2025. 
- Stellantis plans to sell the Compass in about *60 countries*, while *U.S.* production stays separate to avoid tariffs; Italy’s output is forecast to dip in 2025 before gains in 2026–27.

items.title: Varun Beverages joins hands with Carlsberg for African beer market, announces new refrigeration venture in India
Govt to drop green clearance for UCG pilots
items.summary:
- *MoEFCC* has agreed to exempt the pilot phase of underground coal gasification from environmental clearance.
- Of the 41 coal blocks put up for sale, 21 are suitable for *UCG* because they are deep-seated and uneconomical to extract.
- The government targets gasifying **100 million tonnes of coal by 2030**, leveraging *UCG* to power the hydrogen economy.

items.title: India, Russia discuss ways to strengthen defence cooperation
items.author: PTI
items.summary: - Indian and Russian military officials in New Delhi reaffirmed their commitment to *elevating defence cooperation* and exploring new avenues for collaboration. - The 5th Meeting of the Working Group on Military Cooperation under the IRIGC-M&MTC reviewed current plans and explored *new initiatives* under the **Special and Privileged Strategic Partnership**. - The discussions emphasized ongoing engagements, enhanced training exchanges, and knowledge-sharing within the HQ IDS and Russia's *Main Directorate of International Military Cooperation*.

items.title: India's copper demand up 9.3% in FY25, ICA urges reserves
items.summary:
- *ICA India* reports copper demand rising *9.3% YoY* to *1,878 kt* in FY25, led by *infrastructure*, *construction*, *renewables*, and *EV adoption*.
- The report urges proactive planning to build *above-ground reserves*, strengthen domestic supply chains, promote *import substitution*, and expand a robust *recycling ecosystem*.
- The share of *secondary copper* rose to 42%, net imports fell 34%, with *504 kt* end-of-life/process scrap and *214 kt* imported scrap in FY25.

items.title: Bondada Engg H1 FY26 Profit Soars 151%
items.summary:
- Bondada Engineering Limited (BEL) posted a **151% YoY** rise in H1 FY26 net profit to **₹92.56 crore**. 
- Revenue jumped **153%** to **₹1,216 crore**, with EBITDA at **₹143.03 crore** and an order book of **₹5,989 crore**, signaling strong momentum across segments. 
- **Renewable energy** led growth, contributing **78% (₹955 crore)** of revenue, with telecom 14% and products 8%, and the outlook suggests around **40%** of annual revenue in H1 and **60%** in H2, implying accelerated growth.

items.title: AI chip giant Nvidia becomes world's first $5 trillion company
items.summary:
- Nvidia became the world's first **$5 trillion** company as investors bet on *artificial intelligence* driving a new wave of innovation.
- The stock surged ~4.91% to **$210.90** at the open, lifting market cap past the threshold amid deals and hopes to regain access to **China**.
- Partnerships include up to **$100B** in OpenAI and a **$5B** investment in Intel, underscoring Nvidia's leadership in AI hardware.

items.title: Garmin lifts profit outlook; outdoor weakness weighs shares
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **Garmin** lifts full-year profit outlook to **$8.15 per share**, beating estimates as revenue lags in some segments.
- Outdoor revenue fell about *5%* in the quarter, with weakness in *auto* and adventure-watch categories; auto OEM revenue down about *2%*.
- Total operating expenses rose *15%* to **$590 million**, led by higher personnel costs in *R&D* and SG&A.

items.title: World’s first AI-powered fighter jet designed with no pilot and no runway required
Nvidia-supplier SK Hynix bets on chip 'super cycle' after booking record profit
Indian luggage industry to touch ₹267 bn by 2028
items.summary:
- The Indian luggage market is projected to reach *₹267 billion* by CY28, with a CAGR of *12%* from CY23 to CY28, per Motilal Oswal. 
- After contracting to *₹60 billion* in CY20 due to COVID-19, the market rebounded with a robust *37% CAGR* between CY20 and CY23, while *branded players* held about *52%* market share in CY23. 
- Growth is driven by *urbanization*, *premiumization*, expansion of *e-commerce*, and tech innovations like *smart luggage* with GPS and USB ports, turning luggage into a *status symbol* in both urban and semi-urban markets.

items.title: Govt aligns medical device packaging rules
items.summary:
- The *Legal Metrology (Packaged Commodities) Amendment Rules, 2025* align packaging for *medical devices* with the *Medical Devices Rules, 2017*, reducing overlap and boosting consumer protection.
- For medical devices, the *Medical Devices Rules* govern the size and placement of declarations, and relaxations under Rule 33 no longer apply, ensuring consistent labeling.
- Harmonized labeling and single-set standards simplify compliance across states, supporting the *Ease of Living* and *Ease of Doing Business* initiatives.

items.title: BHEL Q2 FY26 net profit rises to ₹375 crore
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- *BHEL* posted Q2 FY26 net profit of ₹374.89 crore, up 253% YoY from ₹106.15 crore. 
- Consolidated revenue from operations rose to ₹7,512 crore, up 14% YoY from ₹6,584 crore. 
- *Power segment* revenue climbed 45% to ₹5,675.64 crore; prior quarter showed a ₹455.50 crore net loss.

items.title: Enlight Metals to invest ₹80 cr in AI dark stores
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Enlight Metals will invest ₹80 crore to set up 10 *AI-powered* dark stores across India, expanding its network beyond Mumbai and Pune.
- The hubs will use *AI-based* inventory, predictive analytics, and regional OEM support to boost *supply chain efficiency* for over 1,500 OEMs.
- About 50% of the funds go to infrastructure and automation, with the remainder for digital platforms, *AI planning*, and workforce development, signaling a long-term *data-driven* distribution model.

items.title: Solex Energy inks pact with ISC Konstanz on solar cells
items.summary: - **MoU** with Germany's **ISC Konstanz** to upgrade the **TOPCon** cell line and advance solar-cell manufacturing.\n- The partnership supports **Vision 2030**, aiming for a **₹1 lakh crore** valuation, about **₹12,500 crore** investment, and a 25,000‑strong workforce in India.\n- ISC Konstanz will provide tech and an in‑house **R&D** facility leveraging its patent portfolio to boost **solar efficiency** and **reliability**.

items.title: Blue Dart clocks 31% rise in Q2 net profit
items.summary:
- Blue Dart Express Ltd reported a net profit rise of *30.8%* for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, to ₹79.5 crore on revenue of ₹1,549 crore.
- On a half-year basis, standalone net profit jumped *12.6%* to ₹126.43 crore on *7.2%* higher net sales to ₹2,991.25 crore in H1 FY26 over H1 FY25.
- The company cited growth from network expansion and investments in ground hubs and automation, plus new initiatives like the Digital Account Opening platform and Green Integrated Ground Hub, aligned with its focus on *digitalisation*, *green logistics*, and a long-term growth strategy.

items.title: MMCM launches India’s first circularity-linked carbon credits from end-of-life vehicles
Nvidia buys $1B stake in Nokia, expands AI ties
items.author: TOI Tech Desk
items.summary:
- Nvidia takes a roughly 2.9% stake by investing about **$1B** for more than 166 million Nokia shares via ADS.
- The tie includes a strategic partnership on **6G development** and **AI networking**, with software optimization and data-centre integration to bolster Nokia's AI infrastructure.
- Nokia will use the proceeds to accelerate trusted connectivity for the **AI supercycle** and cloud initiatives, while Nvidia expands its AI investments, including in **OpenAI**.

items.title: Abu Dhabi to invest $2 billion in Maharashtra’s ports and shipbuilding sector
Sundram Fasteners posts highest H1 net profit ₹300.69 cr
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Sundram Fasteners (SFL) reported its highest-ever consolidated net profit of *₹300.69 crore* for the half-year ended 30 September 2025, with consolidated revenue of *₹3,054.41 crore*. 
- The board declared an interim dividend of *₹3.75 per share* (375%), and quarterly standalone revenue was *₹1,338.37 crore* with EBITDA *₹243.67 crore* and net profit *₹140.27 crore*. 
- SFL plans to scale non-auto, EV and related sectors and is expanding sales/marketing in *Europe* despite global trade uncertainties.

items.title: Alpex Solar upgrades solar cell capacity to 2.2 GW
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - **Alpex Solar** raises capacity to **2.2 GW** and adopts **G12R TOPCon** at the **Kosi Kotwan** plant in **UP**.\n- Phase I: **1.4 GW** with trial in **FY2026-27**; Phase II: **800 MW** in six months; funded by **internal accruals**.\n- Full **2.2 GW** by **FY2026-27**; switch to **TOPCon** to reduce future costs and downtime amid India's solar growth.

items.title: BII funds Blueleaf Energy for India's clean energy expansion
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- **₹625 crore** financing to *Blueleaf Energy* to expand India's renewable energy assets, targeting about 2 GW capacity and ~3.2 GWh/year with ~3.1 million tonnes CO2 avoided.
- The deal aligns with India's **500GW clean energy goal** for 2030, as over 220 GW are already installed and solar, wind, and storage expansions continue.
- *Shilpa Kumar* (BII) and *Raghuram Natarajan* (Blueleaf Energy) call the funding a vote of confidence to mobilise private capital for India's decarbonisation journey and regional expansion.

items.title: Jindal Steel Q2 net profit falls 26%, revenue up 4%
items.summary:
- Jindal Steel's Q2 consolidated net profit fell to *₹635.08 crore*, down *26%* year-on-year, while revenue from operations rose to *₹11,685.88 crore* (+*4%*).
- For the half-year, net profit was *₹23,980.36 crore*, vs *₹24,831.15 crore* last year, with six-month revenue at *₹23,980.36 crore* vs *₹29,831.15 crore* in H1 FY25.
- The board approved *Gautam Malhotra* as Chief Executive Officer, effective *October 28, 2025*, ending a five-year search since Sudhanshu Saraf's departure in 2020.

items.title: Trump calls Modi 'tough as hell', hints at early India-US trade deal at APEC Summit
L&T wins large Saudi power-transmission orders
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- L&T's PT&D unit won large contracts in Saudi Arabia to build grid infrastructure, including a **380/33 kV gas-insulated substation** (₹2,500–₹5,000 crore).
- A second package covers **380 kV overhead lines** across 420+ km, under the National Renewable Energy Programme to boost renewables integration.
- The awards show L&T's growing footprint in the Middle East's energy sector.

items.title: Goldi Solar secures $171M investment led by Havells
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *Goldi Solar* raised 14.22 billion rupees ($171 million) in growth capital led by **Havells India** to expand manufacturing.
- The round included investors such as *Ambit Global Private Client*, *Nikhil Kamath*, *Shahi Exports*, and *NSFO Ventures*, backing solar‑cell production in Gujarat.
- The funding supports India's push for domestic solar module and cell production under *Make in India*.

items.title: Tsuyo Manufacturing raises $4.5M led by Avaana
items.author: Jessica Rajan
items.summary:
- *Tsuyo Manufacturing* raised a **$4.5 million** funding round led by **Avaana Capital**.
- The funds will finance a new greenfield manufacturing facility, an **R&D center**, and expanded exports to Southeast Asia, Japan, Korea and Europe.
- The New Delhi–based company designs EV powertrains, operates two units in Greater Noida, shipped **1.5 lakh** powertrain units, and has four patents with 25 more in the pipeline.

items.title: US strikes $80 billion deal for new nuclear power plants
India fourth largest renewable energy producer at 257 GW: Pralhad Joshi
Iron ore gains on China's steel-capacity plan
items.summary:
- Iron ore futures rose as *China's plan to curb steel capacity* boosts sentiment, with the *Dalian Commodity Exchange* contract up about 1.93% to 792.5 yuan and the *Singapore Exchange* benchmark near $106.15 a ton.
- The proposal would forbid adding new steel capacity in key areas and prevent transfers among key areas, signaling tighter supply amid weak domestic demand.
- *Tangshan* will impose a four-day, 30% *blast-furnace production cut*, trimming about 91,000 tons of daily hot metal output and underscoring near-term scarcity.

items.title: Airbus delays A220 output, narrows 2026 target window
items.summary:
- Airbus delays A220 output and warns the **2026** production target may slip to December due to supply glitches.
- Production challenges in the *US* and *Canada*, including **engines** and **wings**, add uncertainty to both the schedule and deliveries.
- Airbus is taking steps to protect near-term deliveries, including reallocating staff and aiming for a ramp to **12 jets/month** by mid-2026.

items.title: Thyssenkrupp Steel head exits amid ongoing sale talks with India’s Jindal Steel
NXP forecasts upbeat quarterly revenue on recovery in demand
items.summary:
- *NXP Semiconductors* forecast fourth-quarter revenue of about $3.20–$3.40 billion, with the midpoint above estimates as auto demand rebounds.
- For Q3, revenue was *$3.17 billion* with the automotive segment up 6% sequentially and mobile revenue up 30%.
- The Dutch chipmaker has pursued acquisitions, including *Aviva Links* and *TTTech Auto*, and is aiming to close *Kinara* to bolster its neural processing units portfolio.

items.title: Foxconn to invest NT$42B in AI compute cluster
items.summary: - *Foxconn* plans to spend up to NT$42 billion to procure an *AI compute cluster* and a *supercomputing centre*.\n- The funds will be used from December 2025 to December 2026 to expand the *cloud compute service platform* and accelerate the group's three smart platforms.\n- The move follows prior AI and data-centre initiatives in *Taiwan*, including an AI centre with *Nvidia* and the *Stargate* project with *SoftBank*.

items.title: L&T mulls entry into electronics manufacturing
Apple races past $4 trillion market value as latest models revitalise iPhone sales
Wobble to launch India-designed smartphone in November
items.author: TOI Tech Desk
items.summary: - Bengaluru-based Wobble will launch its first premium smartphone, the Wobble 1, on November 19, boasting *domestic design and manufacturing*. - The device is expected to run on a **MediaTek Dimensity 7400 5G** chipset with **8GB RAM** and **Android 15**. - CEO Anand Dubey calls it 'a celebration of India's design, innovation, and creative spirit,' with plans to expand to multiple countries by 2025-26.

items.title: Centre hikes non-urea fertiliser subsidy to ₹37,952 cr
items.summary:
- The Centre raised subsidies on **phosphorous** and **sulphur** fertilisers for 2025-26 rabi season, allocating ₹37,952 crore to support farmers.
- The subsidy rates for nitrogen and potash remained unchanged, while **phosphate** and **sulphur** subsidies rose to ₹47.96/kg and ₹2.87/kg under the **NBS**.
- The government is providing a special package to ensure availability of **DAP** and **TSP** to farmers without higher MRP, with subsidies under the **NBS** for non-urea fertilisers.

items.title: Celanese to cease operations at Lanaken facility, lay off 160 employees
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Celanese will cease operations at its Lanaken acetate tow facility in Belgium in the second half of 2026, laying off about *160 employees*. 
- The shutdown is driven by *weak demand*, high energy and operating costs in Europe, and regulatory headwinds prompting strategic rethink. 
- Celanese expects *$70–$90 million* in expenses (excl. severance) and is pursuing cash generation and debt reduction, including spinning off Micromax.

items.title: India’s industrial production rises 4% in September
items.author: ETGovernment Desk
items.summary:
- India’s *Index of Industrial Production (IIP)* rose **4%** YoY in September 2025, with the index at *152.8*. 
- The *manufacturing sector* grew **4.8%**, electricity up **3.1%**, while mining dipped **0.4%**. 
- April–September 2025–26 IIP growth stood at **5.4%**, versus **5.8%** in the same period last year.

items.title: Shree Cement Q2 PAT up 3x to ₹277cr; rev ₹4,303cr
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Shree Cement's consolidated *PAT* rose 198% YoY to *₹277 crore*, with revenue from operations at *₹4,303 crore* in Q2.
- Revenue grew *15% YoY* to *₹4,303 crore*, sequentially down *13%* from *₹4,948 crore* in Q1 FY26, with cement volume up *6.8% YoY* and premium products at *21.1%* of trade sales.
- Capex/expansion: a *3.65 MTPA clinker line* at Jaitaran was commissioned; a *3.0 MTPA Kodla project* is near completion, as the company eyes >*80 MTPA* total capacity.

items.title: AAI seeks higher import duty and scrap controls to protect domestic aluminium industry
Jindal Steel appoints Gautam Malhotra as CEO
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **Gautam Malhotra** appointed CEO of *Jindal Steel*, effective Oct 28, 2025, per regulatory filing.
- He has led roles across mining, production, HR, logistics, technology and AI, and previously founded *FuelBuddy*.
- The company reported a 26.2% fall in consolidated *net profit* to ₹635.08 crore in Q2, underscoring near-term profitability pressures.

items.title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders, Swan Defence ink pact to build landing platform docks for Indian Navy
Impact of current trade policies on the welding industry in the long run
ABB India expands drive production line
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- ABB India expanded its Peenya, Bengaluru plant with a new production line for variable speed drive (VSD) modules, boosting local capacity by ~**25%** and enabling energy-efficient applications. 
- The expansion supports *Atmanirbhar Bharat* and *Make in India*, cuts lead times by up to **40%**, and leverages Industry 4.0 through automation and digital monitoring. 
- With two decades of India drives production and 50 years of global innovation, ABB drives help optimise energy use across transport, metals and pharma.

items.title: Big-ticket energy push: BPCL signs MoUs with Indian Oil, Numaligarh Refinery, and Fertilisers & Chemicals Travancore
India's electronics sector poised for big leap to large-scale production
Automakers pool with EV makers to avoid EU emissions fines
items.summary:
- *EU emissions fines* could reach up to **€15 billion**, prompting automakers to form alliances to buy *credits* from EV makers to stay compliant. 
- Pools include Mazda-Changan Mazda, Nissan-BYD, KG Mobility-Xpeng, and a Tesla-led group with Stellantis, Toyota, Ford, Leapmotor, Mazda and Subaru, plus Honda-Suzuki and a Mercedes-Volvo-Polestar-Smart venture. 
- EVs were about **12%** of European light-vehicle sales last year and are expected to rise to **40%** by the decade’s end, driving a credit-based compliance path.

items.title: Pharma & healthcare deal surge 166% in Q3 2025
items.summary:
- In Q3 2025, pharma and healthcare deals rose to 72 transactions worth about $3.5B, up 166% QoQ, with pharma/biotech making ~26% of deals. 
- Torrent Pharma led with a $1.4B acquisition of JB Chemicals; hospitals saw 19 deals worth $264M, driven by single-specialty formats and regional consolidation. 
- Outbound cross-border deals rose (Natco’s $235M Adcock Ingram stake) while PE remained subdued, with notable fundraises like Aragen Life Sciences’ $35M.
